newsItems.title: Trump acquitted
newsItems.summary: The US Senate has acquitted former President Donald Trump of all charges.
fullText: Fifty seven senators voted in favor of conviction. Forty three senators opposed it. Seven Republican senators broke with former US President in this historic second impeachment of the forty-fifth President of the United States.

newsItems.title: Vaccination status
newsItems.summary: 3.9% fully vaccinated, 11% at least one dose
fullText: Eleven percent of the population of the US has had at least one dose of the vaccination, The New York Times reports.

From the New York Times: More than 162.8 million vaccine doses have been administered worldwide, equal to 2.1 doses for every 100 people. There is already a stark gap between vaccination programs in different countries, with many yet to report a single dose.
The New York Times also reports that Montana has reversed its mask mandate citing the arrival of vaccines.
